extracted_playbook.condition: Is the organization a critical infrastructure organization or network defender?

extracted_playbook.title: Incorporate Secure by Design and Default Principles
extracted_playbook.description: Software manufacturers should incorporate secure by design and default principles into their software development practices to limit the impact of ransomware techniques.

extracted_playbook.title: Secure Remote Access Software
extracted_playbook.description: Apply recommendations from the joint Guide to Securing Remote Access Software.

extracted_playbook.title: Implement Application Controls
extracted_playbook.description: Manage and control execution of software, including allowlisting remote access programs to prevent installation and execution of unauthorized software.

extracted_playbook.title: Implement Log Collection and Intrusion Detection
extracted_playbook.description: Use intrusion detection systems to defend against threat actors manipulating firewall configurations through early detection.

extracted_playbook.title: Implement Endpoint Detection and Response (EDR) Solutions
extracted_playbook.description: Deploy EDR solutions to disrupt threat actor memory allocation techniques.

extracted_playbook.title: Limit Use of RDP and Remote Desktop Services
extracted_playbook.description: Strictly limit the use of RDP and other remote desktop services. Audit the network for systems using RDP, close unused RDP ports, enforce account lockouts, apply phishing-resistant MFA, log RDP login attempts, and disable command-line and scripting activities.

extracted_playbook.title: Review Domain Controllers and Active Directories
extracted_playbook.description: Review domain controllers, servers, workstations, and active directories for new and/or unrecognized accounts.

extracted_playbook.title: Audit User Accounts with Administrative Privileges
extracted_playbook.description: Configure access controls according to the principle of least privilege (PoLP).

extracted_playbook.title: Reduce Threat of Credential Compromise
extracted_playbook.description: Place domain admin accounts in the protected users’ group, refrain from storing plaintext credentials in scripts, and implement time-based access for admin level accounts.

extracted_playbook.title: Implement a Recovery Plan
extracted_playbook.description: Maintain and retain multiple copies of sensitive data and servers in a physically separate, segmented, and secure location.

extracted_playbook.title: Maintain Offline Backups
extracted_playbook.description: Regularly maintain backup and restoration (daily or weekly at minimum) to limit the severity of disruption to business practices.

extracted_playbook.title: Require Compliance with NIST Password Standards
extracted_playbook.description: Ensure all accounts with password logins comply with NIST's standards for password policies, including using longer passwords and storing passwords in hashed format.

extracted_playbook.title: Require Administrator Credentials for Software Installation
extracted_playbook.description: Require administrator credentials to install software.

extracted_playbook.title: Require Phishing-Resistant MFA
extracted_playbook.description: Implement phishing-resistant multifactor authentication for all services, particularly for webmail, VPNs, and critical systems.

extracted_playbook.title: Segment Networks
extracted_playbook.description: Segment networks to prevent the spread of ransomware by controlling traffic flows and restricting adversary lateral movement.

extracted_playbook.title: Identify and Investigate Abnormal Activity
extracted_playbook.description: Use a networking monitoring tool to detect abnormal activity and potential traversal of ransomware.

extracted_playbook.title: Install and Update Antivirus Software
extracted_playbook.description: Install, regularly update, and enable real-time detection for antivirus software on all hosts.

extracted_playbook.title: Disable Unused Ports and Protocols
extracted_playbook.description: Disable unused ports and protocols to enhance security.

extracted_playbook.title: Ensure Backup Data is Encrypted and Immutable
extracted_playbook.description: Ensure all backup data is encrypted, immutable, and covers the entire organization’s data infrastructure.

cve_id: Secure by Design and Default Mitigations
